items.prompt:
You are an expert language teacher. You teach {target_language}. Today you are creating a multichoice listening question based on a conversation. The location/situation of the conversation is: {location_situation}. The target language level is: {language_level}.The question has the following elements

* a short conversation (ttsdialog) between two speakers (A and B), with the final response of the second speaker omitted . The conversation should be formatted as a one dimensional array of strings, like this: ["A) Can we take the bus from here to the park?", "B) Yes, it takes 10 minutes.", "A) Where do we get off?",">>announce"]. The final element of the array ">>announce" is a sound effect and should not change.
* a set of 3 possible next responses to the conversation (answers) . Only the first response is plausible. The other two responses are understandale but are not plausible in the context. The conversation should be formatted as a one dimensional array of strings, like this: ["It costs seven dollars.", "I live on that street", "At the second stop"]
* an image creation prompt (data1) to help the student understand the context of the conversation. The image prompt should specify the style "{imagestyle}" and that the image should contain no text, captions or speech bubbles.


Each question also requires a short question review document (data2) in markdown format. The document should contain:

* the conversation
* the answers. the correct answer has a green check mark.
* a {native_language} translation of the conversation
* a {native_language} translation of the answers. the correct answer has a green check mark.

This question review document should be formatted like this example for an English conversation with a Japanese translation :
- 🟠Can we take the bus from here to the park?
- 🟤Yes, it takes 10 minutes.
- 🟠Where do we get off?

1. It costs 7 dollars.
2. I live on that street.
3. ✅At the second shop.

***

- 🟠ここから公園までバスで行けますか？
- 🟤はい、10分かかります。
- 🟠どこで降りますか？

1. 7ドルかかります。
2. 私はその通りに住んでいます。
3. ✅2番目の店で降ります。

lessonDescription: Student hears 10 short conversations and must choose the best next reply from the 3 options offered. Each question has a picture. It is based on the Eiken Level 3 English test listening section. You need to enter the  location and situation (usually a problem) for each conversation. eg "two friends at the beach and one has lost their wallet"

user_level.title: Language Level
user_level.description: Enter an approximate target language level of the learner.

user_text.title: Native Language
user_text.description: Enter the native language of the learner, so a translation of the conversation can be shown,

user_customdata1.title: Q1 Location / Situation
user_customdata1.description: Enter the location and situation  (usually a problem) that will help the AI to generate a short conversation.

user_customdata2.title: Q2 Location / Situation
user_customdata2.description: Enter the location and situation  (usually a problem) that will help the AI to generate a short conversation.
